thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Wednesday, 21 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Flight Centre's H1 earnings grow as airline fares, ticket sales improve

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Flight Centre's H1 earnings grow as airline fares, ticket sales improve
text:
Feb 22 (Reuters) - Australiaâ€™s Flight Centre Travel Group Ltd said first half net profit rose 37 percent as it benefited from a global recovery in airfares.
Net profit for the six months to Dec. 31 rose to A$102.2 million ($79.74 million) from A$74.4 million, the company said on Thursday.
The company declared an interim dividend of 60 cents per share, up from 45 cents a year ago. ($1 = 1.2817 Australian dollars) (Reporting by Ambar Warrick in Bengaluru; Editing by Byron Kaye and Alison Williams)
